markdown: For Discussion Purposes MASW PROPOSED REGIONAL CONFERENCES I. SUGGESTED OBJECTIVES FOR REGIONAL CONFERENCES A. For Volunteers (County Chairmen, Special Project Chairmen, Community Leaders) to: 1. understand the problem of hunger and malnutrition in Missouri. 2. understand the background, purpose, and goals of MASW's program, "Volunteer's Against Hunger". 3. know appropriate roles and responsibilities for volunteers and sources of assistance. 4. know the steps involved to initiate a county volunteer program. 5. form a county plan and timetable for launching the volunteer program. ## II. PROPOSED AGENDA A. Program Overview 9:00 A.M. Registration and coffee Plenary Session 9:30 A.M. Opening: Invocation What We Hope to Accomplish in This Session 9:45 A.M. Keynote - "Care Enough to Know and Serve" Testimony of a Volunteer 10:30 A.M. The Case Against Hunger and Malnutrition (Dimensions of the Problem) Panel - Health - Family Food Assistance Programs - Education 11:30 A.M. Volunteers Against Hunger - A Plan for Action (Overview of MASW's Plan) 12:00 Noon Break 12:15 P.M. Lunch Action Groups: The Dynamics of Volunteer Action Against Hunger (All volunteers attend session on each of three topics ... health, family food assistance programs, education). 2:30 P.M. "Organizing for Action at Home - County Volunteers Against Hunger" 3:45 P.M. Plenary Session "Where Do We Go From Here" 4:00 P.M. Adjournment Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/lxvg0227
